title: Uses of nuclear vs. coal and natural gas

content.question: Nuclear power is a component of the line labeled “Other” in the graph. Why is it impossible for nuclear energy to completely replace oil and gas in the future?

choices.label: Nuclear power is unacceptable to the public, so they will not allow it.
At the current rate of consumption, there is only enough uranium to last for fifteen more years.
Nuclear power can supply electricity, but it cannot replace other uses of oil and gas.
Nuclear energy is too costly for general use.
Nuclear waste contributes more to global climate change than do oil and gas.

content.answer: Nuclear power can supply electricity, but it cannot replace other uses of oil and gas.
